Hi Dimity, 

Just confirming that we have fixed up the about us page: https://northshoreent.com.au/about/
@manuel I just realised that they didn't actually link anywhere. All good. I will close the ticket now. Thanks.
@heath actually I tried to find the links on the archived site but no linking found. so, I don't have idea where I go to link.

@manuel can you please make sure each box links through to its appropriate section, you can see them on the webarchive link below. 
Also you can remove the copy "Benign and Malignant lesions of the sinonasal cavity, oral cavity, oropharynx, hypopharynx, larynx, thyroid gland and salivary glands
Cutaneous benign and malignant lesions" from the last box. 

Thanks!

Hi @heath please check if this possible solution...

https://northshoreent.com.au/about/

@manuel when we turned off the Ultimate visual composer plugin on the https://northshoreent.com.au website, it has left a section on this page https://northshoreent.com.au/about/ not loading the content correctly. Here is a link of how it should look: https://web.archive.org/web/20180311172243/https://northshoreent.com.au/about/

Can you please redo this without the plugin ASAP using the normal visual composer.

Cheers,

Begin forwarded message:

From: Dimity Morrison <dmorrison@northshoreent.com.au>

Subject: Update to Website

Date: 10 July 2018 12:02:51 PM AEST

To: Support - Wolf IQ <support@wolfiq.com.au>

Hi,

Could we please make the following changes to our website?

· Dr Justin Kong Bio. Update to read:

DR JUSTIN KONG - MB BS BSc (MED) MMed FRACS (OHNS)

Specialising in Endoscopic Sinus and Nasal Airway Surgery as well as Anterior Skull Base Surgery. Other interests are Childrens Ear, Nose and Throat disorders.

Justin was born in London, but was raised in Sydney from an early age. He graduated from the University of New South Wales Medical School. He then underwent Advanced General Surgical Training, during which time he completed a Master of Medicine in Clinical Epidemiology from the University of Sydney. He began Specialist Training in Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery through the NSW training scheme and subsequently became a Fellow of the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons in Otolaryngology.

Justin then undertook further sub-specialty training in the field of Advanced Endoscopic Sinus Surgery and Anterior Skull Base Surgery in London at Guys and St Thomas Hospitals, Kings College University Hospital and The National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery. This Clinical Fellowship was under the mentorship of Dr David Roberts and Dr Claire Hopkins in one of the largest Endoscopic Sinus and Skull Base Surgery centres in the UK and Europe. During this time in London, Justin also lectured at the Kings College London, School of Medicine.

Justin has published in numerous surgical journals and has presented at conferences both nationally and internationally. He has been an invited Chair of Rhinological Surgery Sessions in Ear, Nose and Throat Meetings in the UK. Justin has also been actively involved in the teaching of medical students and registrars, mainly through the University of Sydney as an Honorary Associate.

In his spare time, Justin enjoys spending time with his wife and three children, playing the violin, fishing and skiing.

In "Our Team" , Delete Philippa's bio and update to Dimity Morrison.

Dimity Morrison - Practice Manager

Dimity has gained over six years of experience in the medical industry, working in Cardiology, Breast, Melanoma and General surgery and now ENT. Dimity started her career working as a Medical Secretary but soon progressed into management roles due to her strong work ethic and leadership skills. Dimity studied at the June Dally-Watkins Business Finishing College where she studied a Certificate IV in Business Administration as well as a variety of other specialty subjects. Outside of work, Dimity enjoys dancing, participating in the organisation of the Rotary Youth Leadership Awards and spending time with family and friends.

· Update Emily Little's bio to read:

Emily Little - Medical Receptionist

Emily is our full time medical receptionist here at North Shore ENT. After finishing her HSC, she discovered a passion in both children and adult's health needs. In her spare time Emily enjoys fitness training and going to the beach.

· Delete Evelyn Heap's bio and replace with Jessica Little. Jessica's bio to read:

Jessica Little - Medical Receptionist

Jessica is the newest member to join the North Shore ENT team. She is currently working with us part-time. Jess has a passion for speech and language sciences, and is currently in third year of University studying a Bachelor of Speech Pathology. In her spare time Jess enjoys spending time with her family and friends and playing netball

· Update the patient registration for with the following fields:

Emergency Contact Details:

-Next of Kin

- Relationship

- Contact Numbers

Account Holder Details (maybe this could be some sort of drop down menu? What do you think?)

(If different from Patient Details. For parents/guardians of patients under 15 years of age)

- Patent/Guardian Full Name

- Date of Birth

- Medicare No

- Reference

- Expiry

· Referrals Page

Update the title to say:

FOR REFERRING DOCTORS. PLEASE FILL PATIENT DETAILS BELOW

Please let me know if you need any clarifications or have any questions.

Kind regards,


Dimity Morrison
